starfleet_message: Captain’s Log, Stardate 47458.0 — While patrolling the edge of the Romulan Neutral Zone, the Enterprise has intercepted a repeating Romulan distress call with no identifiable source. Long-range sensors reveal only faint energy echoes. We are moving to investigate, though the signal’s origin appears to exist outside normal space-time.
mission_description: Upon entering the Neutral Zone, the Enterprise discovers the phased remains of a long-lost Romulan-Klingon outpost trapped within a temporal distortion. Determine the nature of the anomaly, free any surviving consciousness, and avoid diplomatic escalation.

dialogue_tree.line: Captain, the distress signal originates from multiple phase-states of the same location. It appears to be a structure existing in fragmented time.

options.label: Geordi, can we synchronize our sensors to a stable frequency?
options.crew_reply: Commander La Forge: Working on it, sir. The returns keep splitting—like echoes out of sync with reality.

options.label: Worf, maintain defensive posture. The Romulans may interpret our presence as provocation.
options.crew_reply: Lt. Worf: Aye, Captain. Shields up, weapons on standby.

options.label: Counselor, do you sense that there's a sentience from the signal source?
options.crew_reply: Counselor Troi: I sense confusion… fear repeating itself. It’s as if they relive the same moment endlessly.

dialogue_tree.line: I’ve isolated the reflection field. It’s a derelict outpost—Romulan in design, but with Klingon technology integrated into its power matrix.

options.label: Data, estimate the station’s age.
options.crew_reply: Lt. Commander Data: Yes, sir. Structural decay indicates at least four decades. The reactor core is still in flux.

options.label: Data, can life exist in such conditions?
options.crew_reply: Lt. Commander Data: Possibly, Captain, if temporally displaced. But what I am reading is not normal physiology, it is repetition.

options.label: Commander La Forge, reroute auxiliary power and stabilize the plasma flow.
options.crew_reply: Commander La Forge: Acknowledged, Captain. Rerouting auxiliary power.

dialogue_tree.line: Captain, Klingon data buoys in the vicinity identify this sector as abandoned since the Tomed Incident. Entering further could violate treaty protocols.

options.label: Number One, open a secure channel to Romulan Command. Inform them we are responding to a distress signal.
options.crew_reply: Commander Riker: Message sent, sir. No reply, but they’re listening.

options.label: Lt. Worf, maintain position on our side of the boundary until we confirm the threat level.
options.crew_reply: Lt. Worf: Holding steady at treaty limit, Captain.

options.label: Mr. Worf, coordinate security teams and keep tactical sensors active.
options.crew_reply: Lt. Worf: Acknowledged, Captain. Security teams are in place.

dialogue_tree.line: The emotional field is growing stronger. They’re aware of us, pleading for release. The pain is constant, but trapped in time.

options.label: Mr. La Forge, prepare a phased away team transport. Match to their time signature.
options.crew_reply: Commander La Forge: I can stabilize a corridor for about five minutes, sir. Beyond that, we risk temporal bleed.

options.label: Doctor, standby medical containment in case something comes back with the team.
options.crew_reply: Dr. Crusher: Containment fields are ready, sir. Biofilters set to adaptive mode.

options.label: Counselor, monitor emotional patterns among the crew and alert me to distress.

dialogue_tree.line: Away team reports the station phasing between states. Some sections look pristine, others centuries old. Logs alternate between Klingon and Romulan languages.

options.label: Commander Riker, log our actions and prepare a diplomatic summary for Starfleet Command.
options.crew_reply: Commander Riker: Understood, Captain. The Romulan signal has ceased; records secured.

options.label: Lt. Commander La Forge, secure the warp core and conduct structural scans for temporal residue.
options.crew_reply: Commander La Forge: Scans complete. No residual flux. Systems stable.

options.label: Counselor Troi, monitor the crew for any lingering temporal disorientation.
options.crew_reply: Counselor Troi: Emotional stability returning to baseline, Captain.

reflection.line: We answered a distress call from across time itself. Hard to know if they ever realized they were saved.
Perhaps mercy needs no acknowledgment, Number One. Sometimes, it is enough that the echo of suffering finally fades.

debriefs.text: By coordinating precise harmonic inversion, the Enterprise released the trapped outpost and ended its four-decade time loop. Starfleet commended the crew for averting a potential Neutral Zone conflict.
The crew responded to a distress call across time, offering mercy to those caught in an endless loop. The Neutral Zone remains silent, but the memory of the signal endures.

Through restraint and compassion, the Enterprise resolved a lingering tragedy without sparking confrontation. Romulan Command later confirmed the outpost had been listed 'missing' for forty-three years.
An unstable deflector pulse ruptured the temporal field, scattering fragments of the outpost through subspace. Starfleet reprimanded the crew for unauthorized interference in the Neutral Zone.
A premature withdrawal left the anomaly intact. Weeks later, the same distress signal reappeared—unchanged, endlessly repeating.
Romulan forces arrived during the operation, misinterpreting the Enterprise’s actions as aggression. Diplomatic relations deteriorated sharply.
